landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint pleads a residential tenancy (lease began Jan 15, 2022), tenant status, rental address, monthly rent, and identifies Defendant as landlord/owner (or landlord agent), which factually establishes a landlord‑tenant relationship.

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint alleges affirmative acts (Defendant engaged an electrician, obtained quotes) and, more importantly, an omission/delay (Defendant failed to promptly effectuate permanent repair, did not provide timetable or adequate remedy), which are acts/omissions by the landlord.

substantial_interference.reasoning: Complaint alleges the bedroom lost electrical service for approximately six weeks, preventing its intended use as a home office, forcing Plaintiff to work elsewhere, incur expenses, and crowd the living room — facts that plausibly allege a material/substantial interference with use and enjoyment.

causation.reasoning: Complaint links the interference to Defendant’s conduct: electrician reported wiring issues to Defendant, Defendant delayed repairs and failed to provide remedies, and Plaintiff alleges those delays proximately caused the loss of use and related expenses.

damages.reasoning: Complaint itemizes out‑of‑pocket expenses (approx. $15/day for coffee/food, $150/month coworking) and loss of use, and asserts a specific damage figure ($450), which sufficiently pleads damages.
